title: List of works by F. X. Velarde
data: Clubmoor , Liverpool , Merseyside 53°26′12″N 2°56′01″W / 53.4367°N 2.9337°W / 53.4367 ; -2.9337 ( St Matthew 's Church , Clubmoor )
This was Velarde 's first church ; it is built in brick with a green pantiled roof . The church has a tall northeast tower with a copper cupola . The internal furnishings are also by Velarde
Blackburn , Lancashire 53°46′28″N 2°28′37″W / 53.7745°N 2.4770°W / 53.7745 ; -2.4770 ( St Gabriel 's Church , Blackburn )

St Gabriel 's is considered to be a milestone in the development of the Modern Movement in church architecture . It is built in brick , with a truncated tower . The former flat roofs have been replaced by pitched roofs because of leaking . The doors have Art Deco decoration in painted metal . Unusually for Velarde , it is an Anglican church
Bootle , Sefton , Merseyside 53°27′14″N 2°58′47″W / 53.4539°N 2.9798°W / 53.4539 ; -2.9798 ( St Monica 's Church , Bootle )

Inspired by the Continental churches of Dominikus Böhm , St Monica 's is constructed in fawn-coloured brick with a green pantile roof . It has a wide west tower incorporating a narthex , with tall thin sculptures of angels on the west front by H. Tyson Smith
Birkdale , Southport , Sefton , Merseyside 53°37′15″N 3°00′37″W / 53.6208°N 3.0104°W / 53.6208 ; -3.0104 ( Our Lady of Lourdes School , Birkdale )

With a design modern for its time , the school is built in brick with much glass , including a glazed semicircular staircase , and long bands of windows . The windows have stone mullions carved with saints
Greasby , Wirral , Merseyside 53°22′33″N 3°07′26″W / 53.3757°N 3.1239°W / 53.3757 ; -3.1239 ( Our Lady of Pity 's Church , Greasby )
The church is in brick and has a southwest tower with a pyramidal copper roof . The windows are lancets with fluted mullions . The church forms a three-sided courtyard with the presbytery and hall
Wallasey , Wirral , Merseyside 53°25′27″N 3°03′49″W / 53.4243°N 3.0635°W / 53.4243 ; -3.0635 ( English Martyrs Church , Wallasey )

Plans for the church were prepared before the Second World War . It has an almost detached southeast tower , with a sculpture of the Pietà , square bell openings , and a copper roof . The mullions in the windows consist of concrete figures , and the rose window contains a sculpture of Christ
Alsager , Cheshire 53°05′52″N 2°17′38″W / 53.0979°N 2.2938°W / 53.0979 ; -2.2938 ( St Gabriel 's Church , Alsager )
This is a long , low , plain church in brick with side buttresses separating groups of round-headed windows . The windows have mullions in the form of angels with doves
Hindley , Greater Manchester 53°32′05″N 2°34′43″W / 53.5347°N 2.5787°W / 53.5347 ; -2.5787 ( St Benedict 's Church , Hindley )
Velarde added a Lady chapel to a church built in 1869 and designed by Joseph Hansom . The chapel consists of a circular room with a conical roof , joined to the south aisle of the church
Church of St Cuthbert by the Forest
Mouldsworth , Cheshire 53°13′49″N 2°43′59″W / 53.2304°N 2.7331°W / 53.2304 ; -2.7331 ( St Cuthbert 's Church , Mouldsworth )

St Cuthbert 's is a small church in brick . It has a detached tower ( not part of the original design ) with a pyramidal spire , and loudspeakers visible in its belfry . At the west end is an apse , and at the other end is a double- gabled narthex topped by a cross commemorating the church 's Golden Jubilee
Shrine of Our Lady of Lourdes
Blackpool , Lancashire 53°49′22″N 3°00′59″W / 53.8229°N 3.0165°W / 53.8229 ; -3.0165 ( Shrine of Our Lady of Lourdes )

The shrine was built by public subscription as a thanksgiving for the relatively small amount of damage sustained by the Roman Catholic Diocese of Lancaster during the Second World War . It is constructed in Portland stone with copper cladding to its roof and flèche . In the ownership of Historic Chapels Trust since 2002 the shrine is being restored for secular uses
Upholland , Lancashire 53°32′57″N 2°43′40″W / 53.5492°N 2.7278°W / 53.5492 ; -2.7278 ( St Teresa 's Church , Upholland )

The design was influenced by early Spanish churches . It is constructed in brick with stone dressings and tiled roofs . The church has a single aisle , and a detached northeast tower . There is sculpture by H. Tyson Smith inside and outside the church
Monkmoor , Shrewsbury , Shropshire 52°42′39″N 2°43′27″W / 52.7108°N 2.7242°W / 52.7108 ; -2.7242 ( Our Lady of Pity 's Church , Harlescott )
This is a small brick church , with an apse and a square tower
Bidston , Birkenhead , Merseyside 53°24′09″N 3°04′02″W / 53.4024°N 3.0672°W / 53.4024 ; -3.0672 ( Holy Cross Church , Bidston )

Combining Romanesque and modern motifs , the church is built in brick and stone , and has tiled roofs . It has a southwest tower with five round-headed bell openings on each side and a copper-covered pyramidal roof . There is also a baptistry with a circular lantern , and a Lady chapel with an apsidal end . The church is no longer in active use
Harlescott , Shrewsbury , Shropshire 52°43′45″N 2°43′16″W / 52.7293°N 2.7212°W / 52.7293 ; -2.7212 ( Our Lady of Pity 's Church , Harlescott )
This is a small brick church , with an apse and a polygonal tower
